LanguageData.FRMT_CornOil.label: Corn Oil
LanguageData.FRMT_CornOil.description: Corn oil (maize oil) is oil extracted from the germ of corn (maize). Its main use is in cooking, where its high smoke point makes refined corn oil a valuable frying oil. Corn oil is generally less expensive than most other types of vegetable oils.
LanguageData.FRMT_OliveOil.label: Olive Oil
LanguageData.FRMT_OliveOil.description: Olive oil is a liquid obtained from olives (the fruit of Olea europaea; family Oleaceae), a traditional tree crop. It is commonly used in cooking, whether for frying or as a salad dressing.
LanguageData.FRMT_SesameOil.label: Sesame Oil
LanguageData.FRMT_SesameOil.description: Sesame oil is an edible vegetable oil derived from sesame seeds. Besides being used as a cooking oil, it is used as a flavor enhancer in many cuisines, having a distinctive nutty aroma and taste.
LanguageData.FRMT_SunflowerOil.label: Sunflower Oil
LanguageData.FRMT_SunflowerOil.description: Sunflower oil is the non-volatile oil pressed from the seeds of sunflower (Helianthus annuus). Sunflower oil is commonly used in food as a frying oil.
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorCornOil.label: Corn Oil Precursor
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorCornOil.description: A mixture of corn and solvent to be used in a fermentation vessel to derive the associated vegetable oil.
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorOliveOil.label: Olive Oil Precursor
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorOliveOil.description: A mixture of olives and solvent to be used in a fermentation vessel to derive the associated vegetable oil.
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorSesameOil.label: Sesame Oil Precursor
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorSesameOil.description: A mixture of sesame seeds and solvent to be used in a fermentation vessel to derive the associated vegetable oil.
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorSunflowerOil.label: Sunflower Oil Precursor
LanguageData.FRMT_PrecursorSunflowerOil.description: A mixture of sunflower seeds and solvent to be used in a fermentation vessel to derive the associated vegetable oil.
LanguageData.RPHexane.label: Hexane
LanguageData.RPHexane.description: Hexane is an alkane of six carbon atoms, with the chemical formula C6H14. A colorless liquid, odorless when pure, with boiling points between 50 and 70 °C (122 and 158 °F). They are widely used as cheap, relatively safe, largely unreactive, and easily evaporated non-polar solvents.
